title: 220MS+ ping issues on WOW! Internet
body:
I have WOW! internet and for the past few weeks I have been getting progressively worse ping spikes at the same time of day. It's at the point where when it hits 7PM I pretty much have to go do something else until 12AM-1AM because my ping is 200+. Is there anything I can do to fix this? I called WOW and they pretty much told me to shove off.

EDIT: It appears that I am not alone with my problems. I think our best bet for getting this problem solved is for Riot to contact WOW directly.

replies.body:
Hey all,

We are currently investigating this issue and working to resolve this problem. We need more information to address this problem though. Can ya'll run a trace route and paste the results on this board? These steps will show you how:

- Press the Windows Key + R to open the Terminal
- Type cmd and press Ok. A black window with white letters should appear
- Copy and paste this line into the command prompt. You must paste by Right Clicking and selecting 'paste'. Ctrl+V will NOT work:  

> (tracert 192.64.170.40) > "%USERPROFILE%\desktop\Tracert.txt"

- Press enter. This process can take up to 5 minutes
- Navigate to your desktop and open the file labeled 'Tracert.txt' 
- Copy and paste the results to this post

**NOTE: Make sure to run this trace route when you're experiencing the connection issues. Otherwise, it will not be useful.**

Thanks!

Thank goodness. :D Half the issue was getting it through to you guys that this isn't just a local problem.

You'll be surprised just how patient people can be once they know it's being worked on.  {{summoner:13}}
Thank you! Will provide information when the problem occurs later today. Good to hear that you guys are working on it.

The problem goes away later at night but it will return tomorrow and even greater numbers!. My ping will be as low as 23 earlier in the day but when it hits 7PMEST it shoots up to 200+ and stays that way for hours. I don't think the problem is fixed yet
I've submitted another support ticket and linked this page....If anyone else wants to do the same that would be great.

Everyone who is having problems needs to up vote this thread ASAP to grab their attention since this has been going on for almost 2 weeks.  I noticed a slow rise over the past maybe month or so going about 10 ping a week.  Today is the highest I have seen it.  :(
Yeah today it went above 250 for me (that was the last time I checked, could be higher now). I'm doing my best to bring this to the attention of Riot, but every single bit helps.

Hey all,

I know it's been a little while since I last posted. This issue seems to run deeper than we originally thought which is why it's taking so long. We're still working with Wide Open West to get this ping increase resolved. Thanks for your patience so far.

> [{quoted}](name=Digital Ram,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=guN7X7k4,comment-id=008c,timestamp=2016-03-16T17:45:37.268+0000)
>
> Hey all,
> 
> I know it's been a little while since I last posted. This issue seems to run deeper than we originally thought which is why it's taking so long. We're still working with Wide Open West to get this ping increase resolved. Thanks for your patience so far.

Thx for the update. Good to know we haven't been forgotten :)

> [{quoted}](name=Digital Ram,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=guN7X7k4,comment-id=008c,timestamp=2016-03-16T17:45:37.268+0000)
>
> Hey all,
> 
> I know it's been a little while since I last posted. This issue seems to run deeper than we originally thought which is why it's taking so long. We're still working with Wide Open West to get this ping increase resolved. Thanks for your patience so far.

Thank you for at least responding and touching bases with us, it eases our collective minds a bit to know that you guys are still making this a priority.
Thanks a bunch! I have no problem waiting for a fix. Just glad to know you guys are still helping us out.
Thank you very much with the update. While I didn't doubt you guys were working on the problem, it just helps to hear something.
any updates on this mess???

**Guys, what's probably happened is a peer network somewhere has developed a fault.**
"Peer networks" are more like... direct connections, for lack of a better explanation, from you to your destination address so your data doesn't have to bounce every which way to reach its destination. WOW! has had an issue with Google peer networks once and YouTube was slow as molasses.

**HOWEVER**, if this _is_ a peer network problem and follows a similar resolution as the Google problem, then don't expect a fix tonight.

Best chance is to submit tickets with tracerts and other relevant data.
[This page will give you the steps to sent out the relevant info. Just don't forget tracerts!](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#section-windows)

Be patient, enjoy the rain (if you're one of the cool Georgia folks {{champion:119}})

DISCLAIMER: I am not I.T. I am not Rito employee.
I'm just a guy who asks a lot of questions and looks a lot of stuff up.
Can confirm me and 3 other friends all with the same provider are all having the same issue.  Mine is capping out at about 270 near Columbus, Ga.

Hey everyone!

Thanks for providing these trace routes. This should help out quite a bit. I'll post again when I have any updates. Thanks again!
Thank you so much for the help!

Hey All, 

Wide Open West made a change that may have resolved this issue. Please let me know if you're experiencing this issue tonight so we can verify that the issue has been resolved!

Thanks!
No, Thank you. :)

I am still having the same exact issue. Daily from 8-11 PM EST I get MS of around 200. The game is unplayable and this is when I can play League. Please FIX RIOT!\

Yeah, I'm getting the same copy-and-paste reply from Riot. And yeah, it returned for me (and disappeared as well) same as the rest of you.
I mean, I'm following their advice but still....

It's **HIGHLY UNLIKELY** this is a local issue with this many people all having the same issue.

A Riot reply would be wonderful just to hear that they're working to fix it.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

WOW! customer checking in, I'm in Huntsville AL. I'm glad I found this thread because I couldn't figure out what the heck was going on.

Same story as everyone else here... Have always had super nice ping (30-40ms) for the longest time (over a year?). But since about a week ago it's been 200+ms during "peak times".

It only causes a half-second to a whole second worth of delay, but honestly in a game like League where everything is in real time, it truly does make the game unplayable.

Edit: Currently at 196ms. :|  After a long ass day at work all I want to do is unwind with a couple games. This is f@!#ing miserable...
I basically just reached out to RIOT and WOW again and linked the thread because it feels as if we are not receiving any help when it comes to resolving the issue.

I have normal pings to everything except Chicago LoL. I can connect to Latin America right now and get around 70ms, while NA has me stuck at 220ms like other are saying.

Pings to google and other games such as Warcraft, no issues whatsoever.
have WoW! internet around 730pm ping spikes to 230+ms from 30ms all mid day making the game unplayable riot needs to get in contact with them to resolve issues...

I put a ticket in last night, and Riot replied. All they said was this: 

_**We've optimized your connection the best we can, unfortunately the Netalzyr test shows a large amount of packet loss with your ISP, which can be attributed to either high traffic times on your ISP's network, or an issue with your ISP's infrastructure. You need to speak with your ISP and let them know that you are having these connection issues and if this is something that they could possibly look into. I'm sorry there's not much else I can do to troubleshoot the issue, however if you have any further questions or concerns, please let me know.**_

I gave them every single internet test they needed and thats all they had for me.

Here we go again, 8:00 PM EST and unplayable pings nearing the 200 range. No joke, started the night at 7:30 PM with 40ms pings (still higher than the usual 26), and they've slowly crept up through the match until this point at 8 where they are averaging 173ms. High buffer bloat and the occasional packet loss make the game unplayable.

Heard back from Riot. They gave the usual "It's your connection" reply, hopefully I can get an actual person to go into this thread and see that's it not just me and that's it is a company to company problem.
Same issues with WOW in SE Michigan. What time does the ping drop down and it becomes playable?
It has been returning to normal at 1AM EST for me, but it has been getting worse day to day. There's no real way to know when/if it goes down.

> [{quoted}](name=SoV Peaches,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=guN7X7k4,comment-id=00190000,timestamp=2016-03-02T03:25:22.498+0000)
>
> It has been returning to normal at 1AM EST for me, but it has been getting worse day to day. There's no real way to know when/if it goes down.

This is so freaking annoying, I barely have time off work and havent been able to play the last 2 days.
This is terrible.. Have 30 ping from ISP and 250 from LOL
Getting the same issue- around 7-10pm constantly bad lag, unplayable even. usually on weekdays

All I hear is that they are working on it. This level of service would not be remotely allowed in any corporate company. It is embarrassing for the largest game in the world to be unable to solve such a large network issue. They should be able to pressure WOW to fix the problem.

Riot can't walk into a WOW building and just yell at them to fix it. I'm sure Riot is doing what they can do get it fixed. Maybe the problem can't be fixed overnight, it could be horrifically complicated for all we know.
you'd think they'd update us more about the situation, lol.
Why is this still being ignored. I'm confused.
It's not being ignored by Riot, but WOW seems to not have done anything about it yet (that we can see).

Hi there OP, 

Just wanted to chime in here - I live in Grove City, a suburb a little south of Columbus, and my wife and I both play League of Legends - for the last several weeks our ping has been utterly atrocious and there's literally been NO solution from WOW! proposed.

Last time this happened, I lucked out and got a response from Dan Della Terza, who posts on DSLReports.com as WoWDan and he's probably their best employee for how much of his own time he uses on that forum helping people.

He had to put himself in touch with locals, who e-mailed me to confirm they were adding hardware on their end somehow to alleviate the issue (my ping to my World of Warcraft server was also abysmal at that point, to a data center located in Chicago as well)  I've had no such luck this time, but there's a pretty solid thread I made going on DSLReports right now, and one intrepid user has shown us that it's definitely a real problem, and probably on WoW's end: 

http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r30565245-Horrible-Ping-to-JUST-Chicago

Also, I'll post a traceroute and get my wife to put one up, her ping was 220 consistently for three games straight tonight between around 8:30 and ending a little after 10:15PM, but the ping is still high when testing in a custom game.

I definitely think it's something on WOW!'s end, since for everyone posting here and in my thread on DSLReports, it happens for around 3-4 hours on weeknights, during peak times, and that's pretty much a sign of crowded routes or what-have-you, and I don't know that Riot can do much about that.  So it looks like all of us who have this ISP are in the dumpster.  Which sucks for me, because they're about the only ISP I can get where I live, ATT can't reach me, Verizon pulled FIOS from Ohio afiak, and we don't have any of those FTH smaller providers here in Ohio, at least not in Central Ohio.

Thanks for looking into it Digital Ram, I appreciate your effort.

SE Michigan, WOW!. Been having the same issues too for the pat few weeks. By 6:30 or so in the evening games are basically unplayable with 200+ ping.

Hey guys, I have an update for anyone still watching this thread. Riot has finally responded to my ticket and gave some promising news.

> You're correct, Duxy, we're in discussions with WOW right now as their service between their customers and our servers is experiencing issues that they will need to resolve. Unfortunately, I can't promise a particular timeline as we do still need to wait for them to make changes before it will affect things positively. You can assist by contacting WOW yourself, as a customer, and making sure that your local supporter knows of the situation.

>When you talk to your ISP tell them that you have been experiencing ping spikes while playing League, an online game whose servers are located in Chicago, Illinois. When running a trace to our servers in Chicago (using IP address 192.64.170.252) you experience ping spike or packet loss shown on certain nodes in the WinMTR tracer below. These hops are all owned by either your ISP or their backbone provider. These problems weren't seen before, and other services do not exhibit the same issues. This is severely impacting your service, and your ISP or their backbone provider needs to look into these node and any others that might be impacting your route to the League servers.

>~ Rubik
Hextech Support
Trickster of Piltover

So it appears this is an issue with WOW but Riot is trying to work with them on it. Hopefully there is a fix soon as these past few nights have been especially bad.
I was at 150ms and it's slowly gone back up to 200ms again.

Experiencing the same problem.  WideOpenWest Columbus is my ISP.

Throughout the day I experience packet loss and high latency which appears to be coming from Riot's end.  In the afternoon I will have ~23ms - ~85ms with ~5% packet loss, however, in the evenings I experience ~220+ms with 16+% packet loss.

Not my hardware, line, or service.  I have 16% packet loss on my last hop (LoL NA server Chicago).  How can this be my service when it is clearly coming from Riot's end?
217ms again today. Seriously wtf
Yep, not much we can do for now until we get a Rioter's help. WOW refused to help.
It's returned for me as well.
Just got home after a long day of work and tried to play with friends. Ping was 200 and I literally just sat down. This is practically and injustice, honestly.

Not sure about you guys but I got a better reply now. :D

> Summoner,
> 
> Thank you for providing me with this information. We have a Technical Support Team in place dedicated to working with issues like this one, so I'll be sending your ticket along to them. A member of the team will review the information and get back to you as soon as they can.
> 
> Please know that we respond to inquiries in the order we receive them, so sending additional messages or 'bumping' your ticket will actually send your ticket to the back of our queue, increasing the amount of time it takes for us to respond to you.
> 
> Thank you for your patience!
> 
> Vortigern
> Riot Player Support
> Demacian Wanderer

So careful not to "bump" tickets.
Hopefully it's being worked on now.

Have faith in the tech support Heimers! {{champion:74}}
